alert.note: Alert for Ventura (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 14 at 7:45PM PDT until March 15 at 6:43PM PDT by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM PDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is ongoing. * WHERE...Most of Santa Barbara and Ventura Counties. * WHEN...Until 1000 PM PDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding of roadways, creeks, and streams will continue. Road closures due to flooding have been reported in the region. In addition, there will be a significant risk of mud and rockslides, especially on canyon roadways. Moderate to heavy rainfall could trigger shallow debris flows in and near recent wildfire burn scars. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 737 PM PDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated light to moderate rain. Rain may intensity again later this evening. Minor flooding is already occurring in the advisory area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1.5 inches are expected over the area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Oxnard, Thousand Oaks, Simi Valley, Ventura, Santa Maria, Santa Barbara, Camarillo, Fillmore, Ojai, Montecito, Santa Ynez, Agoura Hills, Chatsworth, Carpinteria and Solvang. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Move away from recently burned areas. The rain will likely trigger shallow mud and debris flows, minor rock falls, and flooding capable of localized damage, especially in steep terrain in and near burn scars. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
